result.execSummary:
The defendant Armani M Dulin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 13 days sentence credit, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan through the Inter-State Compact.
Court will allow for the defendant's immediate return to the State of Michigan.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution (payable to Citi Bank).  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended as Agent deems appropriate.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Armani M Dulin in court with attorney todd russell perkins.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
13 Days Credit - IF REVOKED
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  15 Months.
Concurrent to:  anyother sentence.
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan through the inter-state compact.
Court will also allow for the defendant's immediate return to the State of Michigan.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended as agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.

Restitution:  $984.86 (to be paid to Citi Bank - to be paid before costs/fines).
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Balance to be refunded to the posting party.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
